feed.title: NewsTracker: facebook

entry.title: Oculus unveils virtual reality headset Rift
entry.summary: Facebook Inc bought Oculus last year for US$2 billion and its chief executive, Mark Zuckerberg, has said he views virtual reality as the next major computing platform.

entry.title: Facebook shareholders strike down 'one share, one vote' proposal
entry.summary: Facebook shareholders shot down a proposal to give stockholders one vote per share, according to preliminary results from the company's annual meeting.

entry.title: Jets' Bowles Urges Players to Be Smart on Social Media
entry.summary: That's the message New York Jets coach Todd Bowles has given his players about using forums such as Twitter, Instagram and Facebook.

entry.title: Oculus' virtual-reality headset to simulate touch, gestures
entry.summary: Oculus' virtual-reality technology is so highly regarded that Facebook bought it for $2 billion last year.

entry.title: U.S. top court throws out man's conviction for Facebook threats
entry.summary: Elonis wrote the Facebook posts in 2010, when he was 27, after his wife left him.

entry.title: Who Are The 10 Most Popular Celebrities On Facebook?
entry.summary: Who Are The 10 Most Popular Celebrities On Facebook?

entry.title: Facebook Messenger rolls out first game 'Doodle Draw'
entry.summary: Facebook's Messenger platform is rolling out its first game: "Doodle Draw."

entry.title: Facebook earns 51% of ad revenue overseas
entry.summary:
A 3D plastic representation of the Facebook logo is seen in this illustration in Zenica, Bosnia and Herzegovina, May 13, 2015.

While Facebook has reported regional growth in percentage terms, this is the first time it has detailed ad sales outside the United States and Canada as a percent of worldwide sales.

"The next 1 billion consumers are going to come from these countries," said Carolyn Everson, vice president, global marketing solutions at Facebook.

Total advertising revenue for the quarter increased 46 percent to $3.3 billion, the vast majority of Facebook's $3.5 billion in quarterly revenue.

International advertising revenue rose 36 percent from a year earlier, Facebook said.

Mobile advertising represents more than 70 percent of Facebook's total ad revenue, and mobile is particularly strong and attractive to advertisers in emerging markets, Everson said.

entry.title: Russia threatens block on Google, Twitter, Facebook
entry.summary:
Google, Twitter and Facebook face being blocked in Russia after being warned against violating the country's controversial blogging laws.

Twitter and Facebook have been popular platforms for critics of Russian President Vladimir Putin, so the Moscow move has not come as a surprise to the companies and industry-watchers.

entry.title: Google, Facebook join Red Cross to find thousands missing after Nepal quake
entry.summary:
Facebook has also launched its Safety Check tool https://www.facebook.com/safetycheck/nepalearthquake for Nepal, drawing praise from Facebook members.

"It's a simple way to let family and friends know you're okay. If you're in one of the areas affected by the earthquake, you'll get a notification asking if you're safe, and whether you want to check on any of your friends," Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg posted.

"When you or someone in your family is in danger, you'll try ANY kind of contact and I'm glad Facebook helped me today. Connection is what matters."

"My father and friends are in the area and one of the first contact points we had to get some news was Facebook. This media is not always about likes and fun," the woman wrote in response to Zuckerberg's post.

entry.title: Women pictured on Penn St. frat's Facebook page talk to cops
38 members ousted from Penn State frat after chapter is suspended over nude Facebook photos
38 Members Ousted From Suspended Penn State Fraternity
entry.summary: Nearly 40 members have been removed from a Penn State fraternity that's been suspended for three years over a Facebook page featuring photos of nude and semi-nude women.

entry.title: Facebook rolls out new Android app for emerging markets
entry.summary: Facebook Lite is part of the world's largest social media network's expansion into emerging markets.

entry.title: Regina woman, 18, accused of urging young boys to fight in Facebook video: Cops
entry.summary: An 18-year-old Regina woman has been charged with assault after she was allegedly heard off-camera urging two boys, ages seven and nine, to fight in a clip posted on Facebook last month, police say.

entry.title: Facebook addiction linked to depression
entry.summary:
They define Facebook intrusion as "excessive involvement in Facebook, disrupting day-today activities and interpersonal relationships."

One was designed to measure levels of Facebook intrusion, and the other to detect depression.

The study team found that the amount of time spent on the Internet daily was positively associated with levels of Facebook intrusion, and that Facebook intrusion was linked with higher depression scores.

entry.title: Facebook COO '30 years sadder' after husband's death
Sandberg on mourning: 'I want to choose life and meaning'
entry.summary:
Facebook's Sheryl Sandberg on mourning her husband: 'I want to choose life and meaning.'

On Wednesday, she took to her Facebook page to mark the end of an official Jewish mourning period by writing that she wants to "give back some of what others have given me."

entry.title: Facebook announces plans to start building third data center in Des Moines suburb of Altoona
entry.summary: Facebook did not provide information about construction costs.

entry.title: Facebook to Build Third Data Center in Central Iowa
entry.summary:
Facebook is building another data center in central Iowa.

Facebook began serving traffic from its first data center in Altoona in November 2014.

entry.title: Facebook opens artificial intelligence lab in Paris
Facebook to open AI lab in Paris
Drag queens, Native Americans and others protest Facebook's 'real name' policy
entry.summary:
Facebook said it requires that users provide their "authentic identity" because it holds people accountable for what they say online, protecting people from harassment and cyberbullying.

Facebook, which publicly apologized in October to the LGBT community, said it responded by clarifying that the site does not require a legal name and allowing for more ways and time for people to verify their identity.

entry.title: Drag queens, Native Americans and others protest Facebook's 'real name' policy
Supreme Court tosses conviction in Facebook threat case
High court throws out conviction for Facebook threats
entry.summary: After his wife obtained a protective order, Elonis wrote on Facebook: "Is it thick enough to stop a bullet?"

entry.title: Supreme Court gives Facebook 'rapper' second chance in threat case
entry.summary: The government said the standard used by lower courts - that Elonis' words on Facebook could be viewed as threats by a reasonable person reading them - was sufficient, and his intent did not have to be proved.

entry.title: U.S. top court throws out conviction for Facebook threats
entry.summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday threw out the conviction of a Pennsylvania man found guilty of making threatening statements on Facebook to his estranged wife, law enforcement officers and others.

entry.title: Supreme Court rejects conviction for Facebook threats
entry.summary: The Supreme Court on Monday threw out the conviction of a Pennsylvania man convicted of making threats on Facebook, but dodged the free speech issues that had made the case intriguing to First Amendment advocates.

entry.title: Supreme Court rejects conviction for Facebook threats
entry.summary: Elonis was prosecuted under a law banning illegal threats after he posted Facebook rants in the form of rap lyrics about killing his estranged wife, harming law enforcement officials and shooting up a school.

entry.title: Drag queens, Native Americans and others protest Facebook's 'real name' policy
entry.summary:
But drag queens, Native Americans, domestic violence survivors and others said the rule has the opposite effect, with some people reporting them to Facebook for not using an "authentic identity," causing them to get locked out of their accounts.

They want Facebook to remove the option that allows people to report a fake name, stop asking users to verify their identities and provide an easier way to get in touch with the company if that doesn't fix the problem.

"Facebook's policy is just the tip of the iceberg," she said.

entry.title: Facebook Can Finally Support GIFs
entry.summary:
A link to a GIF from any supporting website will now play perfectly when pasted into your Facebook status bar or in a comments or reply section.

However, after a near two-year wait, Facebook has now tweaked its code sufficiently so that support for GIFs is native.

And while it means that a link for a GIF, hosted on sites such as giphy, tumblr or Imgur, will play on Facebook when the link is pasted in, it doesn’t mean that the social network now supports direct GIF uploads.

entry.title: How a Harvard student allowed you to track your Facebook friends
entry.summary: Facebook Messenger knows where you've been.

entry.title: How a Harvard student allowed you to track your Facebook friends
entry.summary: Khanna wrote that he still uses Facebook Messenger, but turned his location off.

entry.title: Fin24.com | Russia warns Google, Twitter, Facebook on web laws
entry.summary: Moscow - Russia's media watchdog has written to Google, Twitter and Facebook warning them against violating Russian internet laws and a spokesman said on Thursday they risk being blocked if they do not comply with the rules.

entry.title: Russia 'will block' Google, Twitter and Facebook if they withhold blogger data
entry.summary: A company website that publishes statistics on how Facebook handles data requests shows it rejected both of two Russian government requests for information on its users in 2014.

entry.title: Why publishers had to partner with Facebook
entry.summary:
The natural order of the universe was disrupted recently when BuzzFeed, NBC News, The New York Times and a number of other media companies ceded to Facebook the marketing and monetization of portions of their valuable content.

If Facebook sells the ads displayed next to the publisher's content, both sides will split the proceeds equally.

In addition to the trio mentioned above, the other media companies that will be funneling content to Facebook are The Atlantic, BBC News, Bild, The Guardian, National Geographic and Spiegel Online.

The choice to throw in with Facebook could not have been easy for the proud media companies.

entry.title: Fin24.com | Facebook accused of trampling on privacy
entry.summary:
It urged internet users to install privacy software to shield themselves from Facebook's tracking systems, whether they have an account with the social network or not.

It said Facebook had refused to recognise Belgian and other EU national jurisdictions, with the company insisting it was subject only to the law in Ireland, the site of its European headquarters.

entry.title: UPDATE 1-Facebook "tramples European privacy law" - Belgian watchdog
entry.summary:
BRUSSELS, May 15 (Reuters) - Belgium's privacy watchdog accused Facebook on Friday of trampling on European privacy laws by tracking people online without their consent and dodging questions from national regulators.

"Facebook tramples on European and Belgian privacy laws", the Commission said after publishing a report analysing changes that the company made to its privacy policies in January.

entry.title: Burundi takes to Facebook to declare coup 'fanciful'
entry.summary: The presidency then issued a statement on Facebook, declaring the coup to be "fanciful" and announcing those responsible would be arrested and face justice.

entry.title: Facebook pushes to improve benefits, pay for contractors
entry.summary:
Sheryl Sandberg, Facebook's chief operating officer, announced the changes in a blog post late Tuesday.

In Silicon Valley, where the wealth gap between tech industry luminaries and the workers who serve their lunches and clean their bathroom can be especially jarring, the movement has focused on tech giants like Apple, Google and Facebook.

entry.title: Facebook pushes to improve benefits, pay for contractors
entry.summary: Facebook had originally planned to announce the changes last Monday, as the standards are already in place for some workers.

entry.title: Facebook pushes to improve benefits, pay for contractors
entry.summary: The world's largest online social network says it is implementing a set of new standards for its U.S.-based contractors who do a "substantial amount of work" with Facebook.

entry.title: Facebook pushes to improve benefits, pay for contractors
entry.summary: NEW YORK - Facebook is pushing for higher pay and improved benefits for the janitors, cooks and other workers who support its employees.

entry.title: White House praises new Facebook minimum wage policy for contractors
Facebook works with publishers to launch 'Instant Articles'
entry.summary: Sharing articles on Facebook's mobile app is more and more common.

entry.title: Facebook, 9 Media Outlets Launch 'Instant Articles' Platform To Directly Publish News On Mobile Feeds
entry.summary:
(Reuters) - Facebook Inc tied up with nine news publishers to launch "Instant Articles" that will let them publish articles directly to the social network's mobile news feeds.

"Instant Articles lets them deliver fast, interactive articles while maintaining control of their content and business models," said Facebook Chief Product Officer Chris Cox.

The other launch partners for Instant Articles are NBC, The Atlantic, The Guardian, BBC News, Spiegel and Bild, Facebook said.

entry.title: Facebook ties up with 9 publishers to directly inject news
entry.summary: The news publishers can either sell and embed advertisements in the articles and keep all of the revenue, or allow Facebook to sell ads.

entry.title: Facebook ready to test news project
entry.summary:
For publishers, the Facebook initiative represents the latest in a series of existential balancing acts.

Publishers have little choice but to cooperate with Facebook, said Vivian Schiller, a former executive at NBC, the New York Times and Twitter who now advises media companies and brands.

entry.title: Man arrested after 'liking' mug shot on Facebook posts bond
entry.summary: This cellphone screenshot provided by Aaron Pursell of Great Falls/Cascade County Crimestoppers, shows the Cascade County, Mont., jail booking mugshots of Levi Charles Reardon, posted on the Crimestoppers Facebook page.

entry.title: Man arrested after 'liking' mug shot on Facebook posts bond
entry.summary:
(AP) - A Montana man who was arrested after "liking" his mug shot on a Crimestoppers Facebook page has posted bond in a felony forgery case.

Levi Charles Reardon of Great Falls was arrested on April 24, three weeks after an acquaintance pointed out his picture on the Great Falls/Cascade County Crimestoppers Facebook page and Reardon liked it.

entry.title: Mississippi Subway employee fired after celebrating Hattiesburg police deaths on Facebook
entry.summary: - A Mississippi Subway restaurant employee has been fired after posting a photo on Facebook that appeared to show her in uniform celebrating the killing of two police officers in Hattiesburg.

entry.title: Fin24.com | Facebook allowed to sue law firms over fake case
entry.summary: Facebook in statement said it was pleaded with the ruling and would "continue to hold accountable DLA Piper and the other firms who pursued Paul Ceglia's fraudulent claims against Facebook".

entry.title: Facebook Inc?s Oculus to sell virtual reality headsets for consumers from early 2016
entry.summary: Pre-orders for Rift will start later this year, Oculus, which Facebook Inc bought for US$2 billion last year, said.

entry.title: Facebook's Sandberg remembers late husband
entry.summary:
Facebook's Sheryl Sandberg says she is devastated by the sudden death of her husband, but lucky to have known him and shared her life with him.

In a post on Facebook on Tuesday, Sandberg paid tribute to her late husband.

entry.title: Facebook's Sandberg emerges to speak at husband's memorial
entry.summary: "We had 11 truly joyful years of the deepest love, happiest marriage, and truest partnership that I could imagine," Sandberg posted on Facebook.

entry.title: Facebook's Sandberg speaks at husband's memorial
entry.summary: Sandberg in turn took to Facebook, thanking Obama for his friendship.

entry.title: Facebook's Sandberg speaks at husband's memorial
entry.summary: Goldberg's brother, Robert Goldberg, who announced the death on Saturday morning on Facebook, and several friends spoke at the private service, the person said.

entry.title: Facebook's Sandberg speaks at husband's memorial
entry.summary:
"David Goldberg embodied the definition of a real leader - someone who was always looking for ways to empower others," the president wrote in a Facebook message signed B.O., meaning he personally wrote it.

She also changed her Facebook cover photo on Tuesday morning to a picture of her dancing with Goldberg at their wedding in 2004.

entry.title: Los Angeles: Man arrested after he likes own 'most wanted' Facebook poster
entry.summary:
Los Angeles: In a bizarre case, a 23-year-old man in the US was arrested after he liked his own "most wanted" poster on a Facebook page.

Levi Charles Reardon from Montana was arrested after he liked his photo on the Cascade County Crimestoppers Facebook page.

entry.title: Husband of Facebook's Sheryl Sandberg died of head trauma in exercise accident
entry.summary: Goldberg, husband of Facebook executive Sheryl Sandberg, was found lying next to a treadmill on Friday at the Four Seasons Resort Punta Mita near Puerto Vallarta on Mexico's Pacific coast.

entry.title: Wanted man 'likes' own mugshot on Facebook, gets arrested
entry.summary: A Montana man was arrested after he "liked" his mugshot on Facebook.

entry.title: Facebook Opens Up Free Internet Platform
Facebook opens Internet.org amid India web debate
Facebook opens Internet.org to developers amid open web debate in India
entry.summary:
However, the decision drew criticism from some online activists in India who expressed concern over Facebook's control over all data accessed on the service and said it violated the principles of an open web.

The platform will be open to all developers who meet certain guidelines, including that they produce content that can be browsed on both basic mobile phones as well as smartphones and is accessible in limited bandwidth situations, Facebook said.

entry.title: Facebook's Internet.org violates net neutrality, activists say
entry.summary: Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said in a video post: "Access equals opportunity. Net neutrality should not prevent access. We need both, it's not an equal internet if the majority of people can't participate."

entry.title: SurveyMonkey CEO, husband of Facebook's Sandberg, dies
entry.summary:
Tributes to Goldberg poured in over social media from friends and other executives, including Facebook chief Mark Zuckerberg, who called Goldberg "an amazing person."

Television and movie writer John Quaintance said on Facebook that Goldberg was the first person to encourage him to write professionally, changing the course of his career.

entry.title: Husband of Facebook executive Sheryl Sandberg dies at 47
entry.summary:
Family members say tech executive David Goldberg, head of the online SurveyMonkey site and husband of Facebook executive Sheryl Sandberg, died Friday night.

Goldberg died suddenly Friday night, brother Robert Goldberg wrote on his Facebook page.

"Dave Goldberg was an amazing person and I am glad I got to know him," Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg wrote on his own page.

entry.title: Facebook exec's husband dies suddenly
entry.summary: "I am glad I got to know him," Zuckerberg wrote on his Facebook page.

entry.title: Husband of Facebook COO Dies
entry.summary: Dave Goldberg, the husband of Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg, died Friday night, according to a Facebook post from Goldberg's brother.

entry.title: Eye lit up by Facebook for election
entry.summary:
The London Eye is to be lit up every night between now and the General Election with data reflecting the conversation taking place on Facebook.

Studies have shown that conversation on Facebook ahead of an election can increase voter turnout.

entry.title: Review: Little-known Facebook apps might remain just that
entry.summary: You probably already use Facebook on your phone, along with its Messenger app for chatting with Facebook friends.

entry.title: Review: Little-known Facebook apps might remain just that

Facebook's answer is Slingshot.

Facebook employees.

entry.title: Review: Little-known Facebook apps might remain just that
entry.summary:
Facebook's Creative Labs division has churned out seven little-known apps that extend existing Facebook features or try to compete with popular apps.

Nonetheless, Facebook is unlikely to give up.

Think of Hello as Facebook's overlay for your various calling apps.

entry.title: State of the news media in 2015: Facebook and mobile rule
entry.summary: The conflict in Gaza placed sixth on Facebook's list of most popular topics worldwide in 2014, based on the number of posts, comments, likes, photos and videos shared.

entry.title: State of the news media in 2015: Facebook and mobile rule
entry.summary: Pew also found that nearly half of Web users learn about politics and government from Facebook, roughly the same percentage as those who seek the news through local television and double those who visit Yahoo or Google News.

entry.title: Facebook launches video calling in Messenger app
entry.summary: At Facebook's annual developer conference in March, chief executive Mark Zuckerburg said the social network would introduce myriad features within Messenger.

entry.title: Nasdaq to settle Facebook IPO lawsuit for $26.5M
entry.summary:
The lawsuit said Nasdaq violated federal and state laws by not disclosing technology weaknesses in its IPO systems and failing to properly design and test them for the Facebook offering.

Nasdaq said earlier on Thursday that it had set aside $31 million for litigation arising from Facebook's IPO.

Separately, Nasdaq agreed in May 2013 to pay a record $10 million penalty to settle U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission charges over Facebook's IPO.

entry.title: As YouTube marks tenth year, Facebook emerges as video threat
entry.summary: Almost all analysts saw video advertising as one of Facebook's most promising areas for revenue growth.

entry.title: As YouTube marks tenth year, Facebook emerges as video threat
entry.summary:
Facebook Inc said on Wednesday that its users were watching 4 billion videos a day, compared with 3 billion in January and just 1 billion in September.

Facebook shares were down about 1 percent at $83.92 in early trading on Thursday.

The brokerage expects Facebook's revenue from video advertising to reach about $1 billion this year.

"More than 75 percent of global video views on Facebook occur on mobile, and we believe mobile video will become more important to marketers over time," she said.

entry.title: Facebook's quarterly revenue growth slows
entry.summary: As a result, Facebook's operating expenses rose 83% in the first quarter as R&D costs jumped 133% and marketing and sales spending nearly doubled.

entry.title: Facebook revenue growth slows, costs weigh on profit
entry.summary:
However, Facebook said monthly active users grew 13 percent over a year ago to 1.44 billion, with 87 percent of them accessing its service on smartphones and other mobile devices.

Facebook said revenue rose to $3.54 billion from $2.50 billion.

entry.title: At Facebook, Big Growth and Bigger Spending
Still got it: Facebook mobile ad revenue continues to surge
entry.summary: Facebook's share of the $42.6 billion worldwide mobile advertising market was 17.4 percent last year, according to research firm eMarketer, up from 16.4 percent a year earlier.

entry.title: Still got it: Facebook mobile ad revenue continues to surge
entry.summary: Facebook has grown mobile ad revenue steadily since 2012, when it started showing ads for the devices' smaller screens.

entry.title: Still got it: Facebook mobile ad revenue continues to surge
entry.summary: He said Facebook will continue to experiment with apps for mobile.

entry.title: Facebook's mobile ad intake continues to surge
entry.summary:
NEW YORK -- Nearly three-quarters of Facebook's advertising revenue now comes from mobile ads, as many more users access the social network on smartphones and other handheld gadgets.

Facebook had 1.44 billion monthly active users as of March, up 13 per cent from a year earlier.

The number of users who accessed Facebook on mobile devices at least once a month grew 24 per cent to 1.25 billion.

entry.title: Still got it: Facebook mobile ad revenue continues to surge
Hello? Facebook launches voice-calling app for Android phones
entry.summary: Called "Hello," the stand-alone app is the seventh child of Facebook Creative Labs, the company's arm tasked with creating new applications outside of Facebook.

entry.title: Hello? Facebook launches voice-calling app for Android phones
entry.summary: Facebook unveiled a new voice-calling app for Android phones on Wednesday, the same day that its WhatsApp messaging service introduced voice-calling for iOS devices.

entry.title: Facebook starts testing mobile calling app Hello
entry.summary: Facebook Inc said it started testing its mobile calling app Hello on Android, which allows users to connect with Facebook to see the identity and information about callers even if the number is not saved on the phone.

entry.title: Facebook tests mobile calling app 'Hello'
Facebook earnings: Here's what to watch
Facebook shifts News Feed, gives priority to friends
entry.summary: While the changes could drive down the so-called referral traffic -- such as articles shared from newspapers -- Facebook is reported to be in talks with media organizations to host this content in an effort to better target news at specific readers.

entry.title: Facebook is making your News Feed more about your actual friends
entry.summary: Most importantly, Facebook wants "to ensure that content posted directly by the friends you care about, such as photos, videos, status updates or links, will be higher up in News Feed so you are less likely to miss it."

entry.title: Fugitive fails to revive Facebook lawsuit, block criminal case
entry.summary:
The 2nd U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals in New York said "overwhelming forensic evidence" showed that a 2003 "Work for Hire" contract that Ceglia claimed entitled him to a 50 percent stake in Facebook was forged.

Ceglia alleged that an April 2003 contract with Zuckerberg, then a Harvard University freshman who had done programming work for Ceglia's StreetFax.com, entitled him to half of Facebook.

It also said the discovery of the real StreetFax contract between Ceglia and Zuckerberg for a project unrelated to Facebook "puts the lie" to Ceglia's claim.

entry.title: Fugitive fails to revive Facebook lawsuit, block criminal case
entry.summary: The criminal case arose from Ceglia's June 2010 civil lawsuit in upstate New York against Menlo Park, California-based Facebook and Zuckerberg.

entry.title: Veterinarian investigated for cat death shown bragging about it on Facebook
entry.summary:
BRENHAM, Texas (AP) -- Authorities are investigating whether animal cruelty charges should be pursued against a Texas veterinarian shown in a Facebook posting bragging about killing a cat with a bow and arrow.

The operators of the Brenham clinic where Lindsey worked said Friday she was fired after they learned of the posting, which first appeared Wednesday night and has since been removed, along with her Facebook account.

entry.title: Accused Facebook fraud fugitive still missing, U.S. appeals court hears
entry.summary: That case stemmed from a 2010 lawsuit against Facebook and Zuckerberg in Buffalo, New York, in which Ceglia said Zuckerberg, then a student at Harvard University, signed a contract giving him half of a planned social networking website.

entry.title: Accused Facebook fraud fugitive still missing, U.S. appeals court hears
entry.summary: Ceglia was charged in 2012 with fraud for forging documents to extort Zuckerberg out of 50 percent of Facebook, whose market value as of Wednesday's close was about $231 billion.

entry.title: Accused Facebook fraud fugitive still missing, U.S. appeals court hears
entry.summary: Orin Snyder, Facebook's lawyer, countered that Arcara had authority to dismiss the "litigation fraud" that Ceglia was pursuing.

entry.title: U.N. envoy to Yemen announces resignation: Facebook statement
entry.summary: DUBAI (Reuters) - United Nations envoy to Yemen Jamal Benomar announced his resignation on Wednesday, according to a statement on his official Facebook page.

entry.title: Yahoo and Facebook shares outperform Google in Frankfurt
entry.summary: Yahoo's Frankfurt-listed shares (YHOO.F) were up 1.1 percent, while Facebook's Frankfurt-listed stock (FB2A.F) rose 1.3 percent.

entry.title: Pew Research Center: Teens still use Facebook
entry.summary: Aided hugely by smartphones and other mobile devices, 71 percent of teens surveyed said they use Facebook, with the same percentage saying they use more than one social network of seven options they were asked about.

entry.title: Pew Research Center: Teens still use Facebook
entry.summary:
Facebook remains the most used social media site among American teens ages 13 to 17, according to a new study from the Pew Research Center.

NEW YORK (AP) - Remember those declarations that teens are done with Facebook?

Among 22 percent of teens who use just one site, 66 percent use Facebook, 13 percent use Google Plus, 13 percent are Instagram users and 3 percent use Snapchat.

The latest study points to Facebook as a dominant force in teens' online lives even as Instagram and Snapchat have gained momentum.

Facebook was the site they used most frequently, at 41 percent, followed by Instagram at 20 percent and Snapchat at 11 percent.

entry.title: Catholic school teacher suspended for gay remarks reinstated
entry.summary: SOMERVILLE, N.J. (AP) - A Catholic school teacher suspended after she wrote in a Facebook post that gays "want to reengineer western civ into slow extinction" has been reinstated.

entry.title: Italian right-wing leader says Facebook blocks his personal page
Italian right-wing leader says Facebook blocks his personal page
entry.summary:
A Facebook spokeswoman said there was a temporary block on Salvini's page because it violated Facebook policies around "hate speech".

Facebook did not mention the word "gipsy" or the Italian equivalent, "zingara".

He uploaded to Facebook and Twitter a video of a well-known song called "Zingara" by Italian singer Iva Zanicchi, asking if Facebook would block that too.

"Facebook blocked my personal profile for 24 hours because of the presence of the words "zin*ari" e "zin*are" in two posts. This is madness!"

entry.title: Facebook tries to halt privacy class action suit
entry.summary: Schrems is claiming damages for alleged data violations by Facebook, including by aiding the U.S. National Security Agency in running its PRISM programme, which mined the personal data of Facebook users.

entry.title: Facebook seeks to halt privacy case in Austria
entry.summary:
Facebook has presented a long list of procedural objections to an Austrian court trying to halt a class action lawsuit for 25,000 users that accuses the social media giant of violating their privacy.

The suit is the latest of several legal challenges in Europe and the United States to Facebook for the way it shares users' personal data with businesses or governments.

entry.title: Lawsuit aimed at 'ending Facebook's surveillance' is filed by student
entry.summary: 'The lawsuit is inadmissible on the procedural level - the court is not responsible,' Facebook's lawyer Nikolaus Pitkowitz told the judge.

entry.title: Facebook seeks to halt privacy case in Austria
entry.summary: The first day of hearings began with a four-hour session in which Facebook's lawyers tried to convince the judge not to admit the suit brought by law student Max Schrems.

entry.title: Austrian student's lawsuit vs Facebook bogged down in procedure
entry.summary: Facebook's lawyers did not address the details of the privacy concerns mentioned in his suit and declined to comment further outside of the court room.

entry.title: Austrian court closes jurisdiction hearing on Facebook suit
entry.summary: The Austria Press Agency says the court on Thursday ordered Facebook to give representatives of the plaintiffs translations of documents before the court within three weeks and for the plaintiffs' lawyers to respond within an additional three weeks.

entry.title: Austrian court closes jurisdiction hearing on Facebook suit
entry.summary:
VIENNA (AP) - An Austrian court asked to hear a class-action suit brought against Facebook alleging invasion of privacy has closed further sessions to the public as it weighs whether it has jurisdiction in the case.

The suit is being brought by Austrian law student Max Schrems and 25,000 Facebook users.

They claim Facebook is illegally tracking their data, including through alleged involvement in the PRISM surveillance program of the U.S. National Security Agency.

entry.title: Class action privacy lawsuit filed against Facebook in Austria
entry.summary: "Basically we are asking Facebook to stop mass surveillance, to (have) a proper privacy policy that people can understand, but also to stop collecting data of people that are not even Facebook users," said Schrems.

entry.title: Facebook Messenger app for browsers
Facebook Messenger is now a standalone web app
Facebook unveils plans for more office space
entry.summary:
Facebook's expansion in Menlo Park, Calif., is showing no signs of slowing down.

Also designed by Gehry, the two office buildings would total 985,719 square feet and have a similar look, feel and height to the new Facebook building across from its main headquarters.

entry.title: Facebook unveils plans for more office space
entry.summary:
In December, Facebook got approval from the city to convert a 184,460 square foot warehouse building into office space.

Facebook is also proposing a new bridge over a nearby expressway for pedestrians and bicyclists, green space and a 200-room "limited service" hotel that spans 120,000 square feet.

entry.title: Turkish academics to fight Twitter and Facebook ban in court
Turkish academics to fight Twitter and Facebook ban in court
entry.summary:
Facebook said it had complied with the court order and appeared to have avoided the ban.

Representatives of both Twitter and Facebook have said they would launch an appeal.

entry.title: Twitter, Facebook, SnapChat, Etc: For YouTube star Michelle Phan, it's all opportunity
entry.summary: Associated Press: Some people are intimidated by all the different apps and social media sites like Facebook and SnapChat out there.

entry.title: You Can Now Serve Divorce Papers on Facebook
entry.summary: Manhattan Supreme Court Justice Matthew Cooper ruled last week that a Brooklyn nurse is "granted permission to serve defendant with the divorce summons using a private message through Facebook."

entry.title: Court: NYC woman can serve divorce papers via Facebook
Court: NYC woman can serve divorce papers via Facebook
entry.summary:
NEW YORK (AP) - A judge has given a New York City woman permission to file for divorce from her elusive husband via a Facebook message.

The Daily News (http://nydn.us/1NNmPgs ) says Victor Sena Blood-Dzraku will be served with the divorce summons via a private Facebook message.

The ruling says Blood-Dzraku has only been in touch with his wife via phone and Facebook.

entry.title: Va. woman arrested for 'Facebook thugging' after gun selfie
entry.summary: A Virginia woman said she was arrested for "Facebook thugging" after posting a selfie with a gun on the social media site.

entry.title: Judge orders Facebook and Zuckerberg to turn over documents
entry.summary: A lawyer for Facebook and Zuckerberg did not immediately respond to a request for comment Friday on the judge's order.

entry.title: Judge orders Facebook and Zuckerberg to turn over documents
entry.summary:
U.S. District Judge Vernon Broderick ordered Facebook and Mark Zuckerberg to relinquish documents by Monday that were requested by Paul Ceglia's lawyer, Robert Ross Fogg.

The judge said he received a letter Thursday from lawyers for Facebook Inc. and Zuckerberg asking that an order he issued earlier in the week to promptly turn over requested documents be suspended until Ceglia is caught.

Ceglia's father told Broderick at a hearing last week that he believed his son might have fled because he believed Facebook and Zuckerberg were working together with prosecutors against him, jeopardizing his chance for a fair trial.

entry.title: Judge orders Facebook and Zuckerberg to turn over documents
entry.summary: Zuckerberg has said he didn't come up with the idea for Facebook until months after he responded to Ceglia's online help-wanted ad and signed a contract agreeing to create some software for him.

entry.title: Judge orders Facebook and Zuckerberg to turn over documents
entry.summary:
NEW YORK (AP) - A New York judge says Facebook and its founder must release documents to a defense lawyer whose client has fled from criminal charges that he falsely claimed a majority ownership in the social media giant.

Manhattan federal Judge Vernon Broderick issued an order Friday against Facebook and Mark Zuckerberg.

entry.title: Great-grandma featured in Facebook photo with newborn dies
entry.summary: Hamm says Life of Dad, an entertainment website, put the photo on its own Facebook page.

entry.title: Uber Hires Chief Security Officer from Facebook
entry.summary:
Cab-hailing company Uber Technologies Inc, under fire for how it charges passengers and ensures their safety, said it hired Facebook Inc (FB) Chief Security Officer Joe Sullivan.

Sullivan, Uber's first chief security officer, has spent five years at Facebook and eight years at the U.S. Department of Justice, mainly in cybercrime, Uber said in a blog post on Thursday.

entry.title: Facebook's new Riff app let's friends collaborate on videos
entry.summary: "Our hunch was that if you could make videos collaboratively, the creative process would be more fun and the final product would be cooler," said Josh Miller, Facebook product manager, in a statement.

entry.title: British sex offender who fled to Australia recaptured and deported after boasting about new life on Facebook
Facebook launches "Scrapbook" feature
MoneyWatch: GoDaddy goes public; Facebook launching new photo feature
entry.summary: Also, Facebook is launching a new scrapbook feature.

entry.title: Facebook apology gripping the world
entry.summary: Mum Kyesha Smith Wood has been called a great mum after she posted a Facebook apology to a cinema patron on behalf of her daughters.

entry.title: Gov. Wolf renews case for his agenda in Facebook session
entry.summary: Gov. Tom Wolf made his second official appearance on social media Tuesday at what was billed as a Facebook Town Hall but looked more like him being interviewed by an aide.

entry.title: Mom uses Facebook to apologize for rude daughters
entry.summary: "My son later told me, much to my humiliation and embarrassment, that my girls were rude and obnoxious during the movie. The woman I'm looking for addressed them and asked them to be quiet and they were disrespectful," Wood wrote on her Facebook post.

entry.title: Facebook moves into new Gehry-designed headquarters
entry.summary:
(San Francisco-AFP) - Facebook moved into its new Frank Gehry-designed headquarters in Silicon Valley, with a rooftop park and "the largest open floor plan in the world."

"That's on purpose," Zuckerberg said on his Facebook timeline.

entry.title: Facebook Reveals Plan for Unmanned Internet Airplanes
entry.summary: "Aircraft like these will help connect the whole world because they can affordably serve the 10 percent of the world's population that live in remote communities without existing internet infrastructure," Zuckerberg wrote on his Facebook page today.

entry.title: Photo of Myanmar's former dictator Than Shwe appears on Facebook
entry.summary:
YANGON, March 27 (Reuters) - Myanmar's reclusive former military dictator, Than Shwe, appears to have surfaced in public for the first time in almost four years in a photograph on Facebook showing him being taught to use an iPad by a young girl.

The Facebook photo garnered more than 4,500 "likes", including one by Ye Htut, Myanmar's information minister.

entry.title: Facebook talks up need for virtual reality, big tech bets
entry.summary:
While virtual reality headsets such as the Oculus Rift suggest video games and entertainment, the gadgets could transform how people communicate on Facebook, they said.

Events such as a birthday party or a child's first bike ride could be shared on Facebook so that users in different parts of the world felt as if they were taking part.

entry.title: Women pictured on Penn St. frat's Facebook page talk to cops
entry.summary:
(AP) - Some women pictured nude or seminude in photos posted to a Penn State fraternity's secret Facebook page have come forward, and some frat members are now cooperating with an ongoing criminal investigation, police said.

The warrant targeted an invitation-only Facebook page run by the fraternity members that showed pictures of women, some apparently passed out or sleeping, nude or partially dressed, and screenshots of text messages discussing sex with the women, among other things.

entry.title: Facebook's Messenger app to mix business with more pleasure
entry.summary: CEO Mark Zuckerberg delivers the keynote address during the Facebook F8 Developer Conference Wednesday, March 25, 2015, in San Francisco.

entry.title: Facebook's Messenger app to mix business with more pleasure
entry.summary:
SAN FRANCISCO (AP) - Facebook's Messenger app is evolving into a multitasking tool equipped to send an animated fist bump to a friend at one moment and then get a little business done in the next.

The push to diversify Messenger addresses a potential threat to Facebook's ubiquitous social network posed by a variety of mobile messaging maps offering more intimate and direct ways to connect with friends.

entry.title: Facebook's Messenger app to mix business with more pleasure
entry.summary:
Younger people, in particular, are increasingly using a wide range of mobile messaging apps to communicate while spending less time broadcasting their activities on Facebook's more expansive social network.

Thanks largely to its Facebook ties, Messenger already has more than 600 million users, Zuckerberg said.

entry.title: Facebook opens up Messenger to apps
entry.summary: Facebook is opening up Messenger to third-party apps.

entry.title: Facebook Expands Messenger Service Features
entry.summary: Facebook Inc (FB) on Wednesday opened up its Messenger service for developers to create apps and for consumers to communicate directly with retailers, in the social media network's latest effort to expand its reach.

entry.title: Facebook Inc expands Messenger app features ?to reinvent the way people are communicating?
entry.summary: Facebook unveiled the new features at its annual developer conference in San Francisco, for the first time allowing developers to create apps that function inside the Messenger app, which has more than 600 million users.

entry.title: Facebook's Messenger app adding more ways to connect
entry.summary: To pull it off, Facebook Inc. is opening Messenger so outside programmers can build features tailored for the service.

entry.title: Facebook's Messenger app adding more ways to connect
entry.summary: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg touted the Messenger expansion Wednesday during his opening speech at a two-day conference for developers in San Francisco.

entry.title: Facebook said in talks with publishers on hosting content
entry.summary:
Facebook is in talks with the New York Times, BuzzFeed and National Geographic about hosting their articles or videos directly on the social network, the New York Times reported Monday.

Last month, Facebook's chief product officer, Chris Cox, said at a media conference that the social network had early conversations with publishers about hosting their content.

entry.title: Facebook to host news from New York Times, BuzzFeed
Family of alleged Facebook fraud fugitive to forfeit bail: U.S. judge
entry.summary: Ceglia's father Carmine said he did not know where his son was but expressed sympathy for him, suggesting that Facebook's principal lawyer was unduly influencing federal prosecutors.

entry.title: Fugitive's father tells NY judge his son thought he could not get fair trial in Facebook case
entry.summary:
NEW YORK - A fugitive facing charges he falsely claimed he's owed a majority ownership in Facebook fled after complaining he was being treated unfairly in courts, his father said Tuesday.

Carmine Ceglia said his son found it "really upsetting" when he was told lawyers hired by Facebook were working with prosecutors on the criminal case against him.

entry.title: Dad: Fugitive son afraid his Facebook trial wouldn't be fair
entry.summary: Prosecutors say Ceglia added a page to a two-page contract he signed in 2003 with Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg to make it seem he was entitled to be part owner of the Menlo Park, California social media giant.

entry.title: Afghan police official fired for mob-killing Facebook comment
entry.summary: Hashmat Stanekzai, the spokesman for Kabul's police chief, was also fired on Tuesday for statements made on his personal Facebook page the day after the killing, Olomi said.

entry.title: India's top court ditches 'Facebook' arrest rules
entry.summary: Facebook , Twitter and Google did not immediately comment on the ruling but the Internet and Mobile Association of India, a trade body, said the ruling protected consumers and businesses.

entry.title: India's top court ditches 'Facebook' arrest rules
Facebook may host news sites' material
entry.summary: Nothing attracts news organizations like Facebook.

entry.title: Man sentenced in Facebook threat case tied to larger debate
entry.summary: A Nevada man was indicted in January for posting threats on Facebook to kill an African American police officer.

entry.title: Ferguson Facebook case part of debate about online threats
Man who threatened Ferguson officer must stay off Facebook
entry.summary: SEATTLE (AP) - A judge says a Washington state man who posted threatening comments on Facebook against a former Ferguson, Missouri, police officer can avoid prison but must stay off from social media sites.

entry.title: Ferguson Facebook case part of debate about online threats
entry.summary:
He noted that in a separate case - the recent killings of two New York police officers - the gunman posted Facebook threats before shooting the officers.

Abdul-Jabbaar pleaded guilty Feb. 2 for posting a threat against Wilson on Facebook that included a call to "give back those bullets that Police Officer Darren Wilson fired into the body of Mike Brown."

entry.title: Facebook's bite into TV
entry.summary:
LOS ANGELES - Facebook is poised to siphon off a large chunk of spending from TV budgets in the next two years.

By 2017, Facebook and YouTube's combined share of global online video spending will increase to 36% (from 34% in 2014).

"In contrast to YouTube, because users are logged into Facebook's service while viewing their newsfeed, Facebook can leverage all of a user's data to offer advertisers unmatched targeting at scale," DiClemente said.

Moreover, DiClemente noted, "YouTube audiences are more likely to be watching ads with sound, again due to users' intention of watching video content," whereas Facebook video ads autoplay in its users' feeds with the audio muted by default.

entry.title: Facebook clarifies rules about bullying, nudity and more
entry.summary: With about 1.4 billion people using Facebook, the social network sometimes comes under fire for what it takes down from its website.

entry.title: Penn State seeks frat members who posted nude photos online
entry.summary:
(AP) - A now-suspended Pennsylvania State University fraternity's Facebook posting of photos of nude and partly nude women, some of them asleep or passed out, is sad and offensive and could lead to some students being expelled, the university's president said Wednesday.

Police in State College, home to Penn State's main campus, are investigating allegations the fraternity operated a private Facebook page on which members shared frat house pictures of the women.

Police were tipped off about the Facebook account on Jan. 18 by a former fraternity member who shared printouts of some of the pictures.

entry.title: The latest way to pay someone from your phone: Facebook
entry.summary: Its payments systems are stored separately from other parts of the Facebook network and receive additional monitoring and control, the company said in a blog post Tuesday.

entry.title: The latest way to pay someone from your phone: Facebook
entry.summary: Facebook users in the U.S. will soon be able to send their friends money using the social network's Messenger app, the company announced Tuesday, March 17, 2015.

entry.title: The latest way to pay someone from your phone: Facebook
entry.summary: NEW YORK (AP) - Facebook's Messenger app will soon let you send your friends money, the latest in a crowded field of services aimed at an increasingly wireless and cashless generation.

entry.title: Facebook to let users send money to friends via Messenger
entry.summary:
Facebook's entry, announced Tuesday, is free, works with debit cards and is available on Apple and Android mobile devices and on desktop computers.

Facebook will likely expand internationally after the service becomes available to U.S. users over the coming months.

To help allay concerns about security, Facebook noted that it handles more than a million payments transactions on its site every day for its advertisers and game players.

entry.title: Facebook to let users send money to friends via Messenger
Penn State frat suspended over secret Facebook page
entry.summary: Police say some Facebook posts also related to hazing and drug deals.

entry.title: Penn State frat suspended for year over nude Facebook pics
entry.summary:
"The evidence offered by the Facebook postings is appalling, offensive and inconsistent with the university community's values and expectations," Damon Sims, Penn State's vice president for student affairs, said in a news release.

According to the ex-frat member who went to police, a second page dubbed "2.0" was started in about April 2014 after a woman depicted on the first Facebook page, called "Covert Business Transactions," complained.

entry.title: Penn State frat suspended over Facebook nudes
Penn State frat suspended over Facebook page with nude pics of sleeping, passed-out women
entry.summary:
? A Penn State University fraternity was suspended for a year Tuesday after police began investigating allegations that members used a private, invitation-only Facebook page to post photos of nude and partly nude women, some apparently asleep or passed out.

The informant said the woman was visiting the fraternity when a member accidentally left his Facebook page logged in, and she noticed a topless photograph of her had been posted to the group.

entry.title: American in UAE Facebook Case May Have Charges Dismissed
American in UAE Facebook case may have charges dismissed
entry.summary:
DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) - An American helicopter mechanic whose Facebook post complaining about his employer in the United Arab Emirates got him arrested said Tuesday he has been told the company is seeking to dismiss the charges against him.

Pate's Facebook post has since been deleted.

entry.title: Facebook Explains What Should Not Be Posted To The Social Network
entry.summary: Facebook's policies are not changing.

entry.title: Facebook clarifies rules on banned content
Facebook slaps ban on buttocks, buying drugs and celebrating crimes
entry.summary: As a result, Facebook said: 'We remove photographs of people displaying genitals or focusing in on fully exposed buttocks.

entry.title: Facebook explains what posts are not allowed on its network
entry.summary:
NEW YORK (AP) - Facebook is trying to clarify what posts, images and other content it allows on its site and why.

Facebook users who believe that a particular page or content violates the site's standards can click a "report" link to notify Facebook.

Facebook restricts content in countries where it violates local laws, even if that content does not violate its community standards.

entry.title: Facebook explains what posts are not allowed on its network
entry.summary:
FILE - In this June 11, 2014 file photo, a man walks past a mural in an office on the Facebook campus in Menlo Park, Calif.

In a blog post Monday, Facebook said it is a challenge to maintain one set of standards that meet the needs of its entire community.

More than 80 percent of Facebook users are outside the U.S. and Canada.

entry.title: What you can and cannot post on Facebook
Facebook clarifies guidelines on acceptable posts
entry.summary: Facebook said earlier this year it was putting warnings on "graphic content," which would also be banned for users under 18.

entry.title: Facebook clarifies guidelines on acceptable posts
entry.summary:
Facebook on Monday updated its "community standards" guidelines, giving users more clarity on acceptable posts relating to nudity, violence, hate speech and other contentious topics.

The move comes with Facebook and other social media struggling with defining acceptable content and freedom of expression.

entry.title: Facebook clarifies guidelines on acceptable posts
entry.summary: The new guidelines say Facebook will take down "graphic images when they are shared for sadistic pleasure or to celebrate or glorify violence."

entry.title: Facebook report shows slight rise in government requests for data
entry.summary:
Facebook Inc recorded a slight increase in government requests for account data in the second half of 2014, according to its Global Government Requests Report, which includes information about content removal.

Facebook said it restricted 9,707 pieces of content for violating local laws, 11% more than in the first half, with access restricted to 5,832 pieces in India and 3,624 in Turkey.

Bickert said Facebook challenges requests that appear to be "unreasonable" or "overbroad" and if a country requests content be removed because it is illegal, Facebook may restrict access only in that country.

Facebook, Microsoft, Yahoo and Google last year began publishing details about the number of government requests for data they receive.

entry.title: Six things Facebook?s new community rules won?t allow
entry.summary: On Monday, Facebook released its updated Facebook community standards.

entry.title: Judge: Man charged in Facebook fraud case apparently fled
entry.summary:
In 2010, Ceglia filed a multibillion-dollar lawsuit claiming that the 2003 software development contract included a provision entitling Ceglia to half ownership of Facebook in exchange for startup money.

Facebook lawyers have said the two had a contract but that references to Facebook were added for purposes of the lawsuit.

entry.title: Facebook exec, NBA team up to get men to 'lean in' for women
entry.summary:
Sandberg, Facebook's second-highest ranking executive behind CEO Mark Zuckerberg, is counting on the NBA's appeal to connect with millions of sports-loving men who haven't read her book.

Facebook is among a long list of major Silicon Valley companies with a dearth of women in engineering and other technical positions, where the best-paying jobs are found.

Women hold just 15 to 20 percent of the technology jobs at Google, Apple, Facebook and Yahoo, according to company disclosures made during the past nine months.

entry.title: Facebook's Sheryl Sandberg enlists NBA stars to persuade more men to support women's rights
entry.summary: Several technology companies, including Facebook Inc., Google Inc., Yahoo Inc. and Microsoft Corp., are backing a campaign that will be punctuated with (hashtag) LeanInTogether.

entry.title: Facebook posts about job land US contractor in Emirates jail
entry.summary: There was disagreement with his bosses about extending his leave to see a doctor, he said, and after a particularly unsatisfactory phone call with them, he took to a Facebook.

entry.title: US contractor arrested in Emirates for Facebook posts about work; accused of cyber-slander
entry.summary: Ryan Pate, a helicopter mechanic from Belleair Bluffs, Florida, took to Facebook after a dispute over sick leave with the company he was working for in the United Arab Emirates.

entry.title: Facebook posts about job land US contractor in Emirates jail
entry.summary: "I never even entertained the fact that I would wind up in prison out here for something I put on Facebook in the United States."

entry.title: Man accused of faking Facebook account for teen sex photos
entry.summary: He used the fake Facebook account to pretend to be another child the girl knew, regularly sending her pornographic images and engaging in sexually explicit chats with her before asking her to send him photos and videos of herself nude or engaging in sex acts, which she did, they said.

entry.title: Will Facebook make a car? Zuckerberg: Focus on the network
entry.summary:
Nonetheless, Facebook's goal of connecting people globally is "pretty broad," Zuckerberg said.

Facebook is also trying to get more people in developing countries online through its Internet.org push and developing its virtual-reality technology.

entry.title: Domestic violence fugitive turns himself in after Facebook chat with sheriff
entry.summary: The Butler County Sheriff's Office posted three pictures of Marcum on Facebook on Tuesday saying that the 21-year-old was wanted on a slew of charges.

entry.title: Google, Facebook update contrasting plans to connect world
Google, Facebook update contrasting plans to connect world
entry.summary:
Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg arrives for a press conference at the Mobile World Congress, the world's largest mobile phone trade show in Barcelona, Spain, Monday, March 2, 2015.

Google and Facebook want more people online, searching around and clicking on ads.

And while Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Google Vice President Sundar Pichai say they might like to collaborate more, they are taking very different approaches to getting the world connected.

Internet.org is Facebook's fledgling effort to create new users in countries with little or low Internet use.

That is the reason why Internet.org does not include the WhatsApp messaging service, bought by Facebook last year.

entry.title: Woman: Ex-beau charged in Facebook killing told me he did it
entry.summary: BANGOR, Maine (AP) - The ex-girlfriend of a man accused of using Facebook to lure a 15-year-old to her death testified Monday that he confessed to committing the killing.

entry.title: French minister meets with Google, Facebook, Twitter
entry.summary:
Twitter and Facebook spokespeople said they do everything they can to stop material that incites violence but didn't say whether they would heed the minister's request for direct cooperation with French authorities.

"We regularly host ministers and other governmental officials from across the world at Facebook, and were happy to welcome Mr. Cazeneuve today," a Facebook spokesperson said.

entry.title: French minister meets with Google, Facebook, Twitter
entry.summary: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) - The French interior minister said Friday he asked Google, Facebook and Twitter to work directly with French officials during investigations and to immediately remove terrorist propaganda when authorities alert them to it.

entry.title: Catch-me-if-you-can criminal who taunted police on Facebook caught
entry.summary:
London: A wanted criminal who taunted British police on Facebook to "catch me if you can" has been arrested.

Just hours later a comment appeared, from James' profile, on the force's Facebook page saying: "Haha catch me if you can wont (sic) see me slipping".

Facebook users took delight at the news - which received more than 600 likes on Gwent Police's page.
